rows.text_1_facilitator: @data.characters.f3_daughter_4.name is playing with the handphone on the floor.

text_1_facilitator.eng: @data.characters.f3_daughter_4.name is playing with the handphone on the floor.

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f3_mother.name: It is nice to see you playing quietly with the handphone while I clear up after dinner, @data.characters.f3_daughter_4.name. In 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will need to give the handphone back to me.

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f3_mother.name: It is nice to see you playing quietly with the handphone while I clear up after dinner, @data.characters.f3_daughter_4.name. In 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will need to give the handphone back to me.

character_1_text.eng: [after 3 minutes] 3 minutes is up, @data.characters.f3_daughter_4.name. Please give me back the phone.

rows.character_1_text: [after 3 minutes] 3 minutes is up, @data.characters.f3_daughter_4.name. Please give me back the phone.

character_1_text.eng: I know itâ€™s hard to stop when youâ€™re having fun. But we agreed on 3 minutes. Come @data.characters.f3_daughter_4.name, letâ€™s go read a bit.

rows.text_1_facilitator: 3ï¸âƒ£ Here are three tips on how to help your child follow instructions more often:

text_1_facilitator.eng: 3ï¸âƒ£ Here are three tips on how to help your child follow instructions more often:

section_1_text.eng:
â­Say the behaviour you want your child to do. For example: â€œPlease take your shoes off when you come inside, Adam.â€
ğŸ‘€Use your childâ€™s name to get their attention, go down to their level, and make eye contact.

section_2_text.eng:
â­Give instructions your child can follow. 
ğŸ’¡ Give one instruction at a time - it is easier to remember.
â° Try giving a heads-up: â€œIn 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will need to give the handphone back to me.â€

section_3_text.eng:
â­Use positive words when giving instructions. For example, say â€œTalk in a quiet voice,â€ instead of â€œDonâ€™t shout.â€
ğŸ’¡Speak calmly but firmly, like you expect your child to do what you ask.
ğŸ Praise, praise, praise! Make sure you praise your child immediately when they follow your instruction.
ğŸŒ·And rememberâ€”this takes practice. Be kind to yourself as you learn too. ğŸ’™

quiz_1_question.eng: Your home activity for today is to try to give specific, realistic, and positive instructions with your child. Do you have time to do this today? â°â­

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: ğŸ‰That's great! Try to remember to praise your child whenever they follow your instruction. You can do it!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: ğŸ’šThat's OK! Learning something new takes time, patience, and practice. You might want to start by thinking of 1 instruction that you find yourself giving your child a lot of the time. Practice with your partner first! ğŸ”„
